header.type: HUMAN RIGHTS VIOLATIONS, SUBMISSIONS QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS

testimony: Mrs Fani your full names please.
You are going to tell us what happened to you at the time of this incident.  Can you please tell us what happened to you Mrs Fani?
My arm was broken and my back was also affected.
Were these people looking for your husband who is sitting next to you now?
Yes.  His name is Mlandelwa Fani.
The police were looking for him because he was a member of Congo?
Yes they were looking for him because he was a member of Congo.
Let us talk about you Mrs Fani.  You said that when the police arrested you they beat you up.
Can you please tell us fully how the police would beat you up?
Yes I can tell you.   They would beat me with rifles and kick me and my back was affected because of that.   And they would beat me with the back of a rifle on my shoulders.
At the time that they were beating you, were they looking for your husband?
Yes but he was not there at the time. He ran away.
Do you have a request other than the ones that you have mentioned in your statement to this Commission?
Is that all that you want to say Mrs Fani.
Is that all you want to say Mrs Fani.
Yes that is all.  My back was affected.

We will now go to Mr Fani?
 Mr Fani, Mrs Fani has already told us that you were arrested at home and you were beaten up.   The police were looking for you.   Did they eventually find you Mr Fani?
I cannot hear you clearly Sir.
Did the police find your Mr Fani, as they were looking for you at the time?
What happened to you when you were arrested by the police?

They were beating me up.  They slapped me in my face and I cannot see.  I am blind now and my ears cannot hear properly.  And when I was arrested they killed my livestock, my cattle and sheep and my horses.  I do not know who killed them but they were killed during this incident.
At the time of this incident, was it after the Nonqulana incident, when people were killed?
Yes, it was after the Nonqulana incident, after the people were shot there.

When the police were beating you up, were you
affected or were you injured in your body?
Yes, I was injured.    I went to hospital.
I was stabbed in my chest.

At home, when they were arresting me at home.
I was trying to run away into the bushes.

The requests that are written in your documents, do you have other requests that you would like to add?   These requests will be taken to the President when we give him our report.  Do you have other requests?
Will you tell us about them please?
I was terribly injured.  They burnt down everything that I had endeavoured to build, even when I was injured.
Is there a request Sir that you would like to give to the Commission.
When I had my livestock I was well, I lived well.  If there is any way in which you could help, would you please do that.
Rev Xundu would you please give the microphone to Mrs Fani?
You see that in your husband's statement his house and his livestock were burnt down.   Who burnt down your house and your livestock?
I do not know.  It was at night.   The house was burnt down at night.   My livestock would die now and again, apparently poisoned, or stolen.
Did anyone in the village have an idea of what happened.
